ai.summary: Butterfly Trail is a 13.1 km moderate hike in the UK with varied terrain and scenic views. Suitable for walkers with some experience, it weaves through woodland paths, open fields, and gentle ascent sections.
ai.terrain_summary: Varied terrain consisting of forest tracks, grassy fields, and some uneven or muddy sections. Expect occasional gentle climbs and open viewpoints.
ai.safety_notes: Check the latest weather forecast before you go. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and bring a waterproof layer. Carry a map and compass or GPS, a phone with battery backup, sufficient water and snacks, and a basic first aid kit. Stay on marked routes, tell someone your planned timing, and be prepared for reduced daylight in autumn/winter.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots or shoes with good grip
Map and compass or GPS device
Headlamp or flashlight (in case of late finish)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) generally offers the best conditions in the UK, with longer daylight hours and less persistent rain; be prepared for mud and showers year-round.

seo.title: Butterfly Trail – 13.1 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the Butterfly Trail, a 13.1 km moderate hike in the UK. Varied terrain, practical safety tips, and gear recommendations for a great day out.
